result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: (bond was ordered forfeited back on 05-24-22, however, notice of the $1000.00 that was posted was never sent out.  Only notice of the $200.00 that was posted was sent out)
(sent to M.S. to forfeit)
Atty. Rashid on behalf of the State and Atty. Mares appeared.  No other appearances.

4/214/2022-Court lifts no contact with M.J.

Defendant DANIEL A. OWENS in court with attorney Brian Lee Mares.  Amanda Nash appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DE request lift no contact with M.J. Court amends bond to allow contact. Other conditions of bond continues.  Further proceedings scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Signature Date:  03-28-2022
Motion hearing on May 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
2nd Bond Violation Report

***$1000 ALREADY ON DEPOSIT***
BAIL JUMP(REPEATER), POSS OF NARC. DRUGS(REPEATER), POSS OF METH(REPEATER)
CONDITIONS:  No contact with M.J.  Absolute sobriety.  No possession or consumption of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.  Comply with the Drug Free 24/7 Program. If you violate the rules of 24/7, your bond is immediately revoked and you will be jailed until such time as you can be brought before the court for a bond review hearing.  May pick up belongings one time accompanied by police escort once 72 hour no contact is no longer in effect, provided there are no other court orders prohibiting contact.

02:33 PM Defendant DANIEL A. OWENS in court, in custody.  Christian A. Gossett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DANIEL A. OWENS appeared by video means.  24/7 VIOLATION.  The State requests bond increased by $200.  The Court will set a $1200 cash bond.  Record closed @ 2:36.
24/7 Bond Violation Report

09:04 AM Defendant DANIEL A. OWENS in court with attorney Brian Lee Mares.  Adam Joseph Levin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  There is also a 24/7 violation that was filed this morning, the State doesn't object to continuing bond.  Defense doesn't object.  The Court will continue bond.  Bond Continues.  The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.  Record closed @ 9:08.  Arraignment scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

08:50 AM Defendant DANIEL A. OWENS in court.  Amanda Lynn Folger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant doesn't qualify for the Public Defender.  Advised of rights.  DE will complete the form for a court appointed attorney. Recess @ 8:51. 
RECALLED @ 9:15 DE appears with attorney Mares.  The Court will remove the PX and set another FP date.  Bond Continues.  The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.  Record closed @ 9:17.  Further proceedings scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.

02:51 PM Defendant DANIEL A. OWENS in court with attorney Eric R Heywood.  Defendant DANIEL A. OWENS in custody.  Christian A. Gossett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DANIEL A. OWENS appeared by video means with Attorney.  Given/has complaint. Advised of charges & potential penalties.  The defendant authorized the Court to send text message reminders of upcoming court hearings.  The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.  Record closed @ 2:57.  Further proceedings scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 10, 2022 at 10:45 am.
